title: Chinese Outflows Complicate Central Bank’s Juggling Act - WSJ

organizations.name: wsj chinese outflows complicate central bank

text:
Chinese Outflows Complicate Central Bank’s Juggling Act The world’s largest stockpile of foreign currency falls below $3 trillion, near six-year low By Biography Lingling Wei Feb. 7, 2017 7:02 a.m. ET 
BEIJING—China’s foreign-exchange reserves dropped below $3 trillion in January, the lowest level in almost six years, complicating the central bank’s balancing act of trying to contain asset bubbles without triggering a liquidity crunch. 
The People’s Bank of China said Tuesday that the world’s largest stockpile of foreign currency fell $12.31 billion last month to $2.998 trillion. The decline was smaller than those seen in previous... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
